content: Hello! How can I assist you today?
I want to talk to you
Hello! How can I assist you with the Ministry of Education & Higher Education in Qatar?
tell me about getting admission in school

The Ministry of Education and Higher Education provides an electronic system for equivalence of school certificates from the first grade of primary school until the high school certificate [doc1]. The purpose of equivalence of academic certificates is to enroll in Qatari government schools and private schools that apply Qatari standards, completion of undergraduate or postgraduate studies, equivalence of university degrees, and joining the various fields of work [doc1]. The user can access the new student registration service by clicking on the following link: https://eduservices.edu.gov.qa, then the main screen appears [doc2]. The new student registration service is for registering students in government schools for the next academic year [doc2]. The vocational bachelor's degree is considered in the department, and applications for its equivalence are not accepted [doc4]. If you need more information, please let me know.
okay is there any age limit ?

The age limit for admission to school in Qatar varies depending on the level of education. Children can start pre-school at the age of 3, and primary school at the age of 6. Secondary school starts at the age of 12. For more information on the admission process, you can visit the Ministry of Education and Higher Education website or contact them directly [doc1][doc2][doc3].

To get admission in school, you need to apply for an equivalence certificate. The requirements for the certificate include a copy of both sides of the Qatari identity card, passport copy, Qatari secondary school certificate or an equivalent book if it is non-Qatari, and previous qualifications [doc3]. The administration may request other documents according to the case of each student [doc4].
